paragraphs.text:
import scala.io.Source
import com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client
import com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.GetObjectRequest
import com.amazonaws.auth.DefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain

val bucketName = "dimajix-training"
val key = "data/alice/alice-in-wonderland.txt"

val s3Client = new AmazonS3Client(new DefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain())
val s3object = s3Client.getObject(new GetObjectRequest(bucketName, key))
val source = Source.fromInputStream(s3object.getObjectContent())

for (line <- source.getLines.take(10)) {
    println(line)
}

import scala.io.Source

import com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client

import com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.GetObjectRequest

import com.amazonaws.auth.DefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain

bucketName: String = dimajix-training

key: String = data/alice/alice-in-wonderland.txt

s3Client: com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client = com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client@417a5e18

s3object: com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.S3Object = S3Object [key=data/alice/alice-in-wonderland.txt,bucket=dimajix-training]

source: scala.io.BufferedSource = non-empty iterator
﻿Project Gutenberg's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, by Lewis Carroll

This eBook is for the use of anyone anywhere at no cost and with
almost no restrictions whatsoever.  You may copy it, give it away or
re-use it under the terms of the Project Gutenberg License included
with this eBook or online at www.gutenberg.org


Title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

paragraphs.text:
val s3object = s3Client.getObject(new GetObjectRequest(bucketName, key))
val source = Source.fromInputStream(s3object.getObjectContent())
val result = source.getLines.toSeq
    .flatMap(_.split(" "))
    .filter(_ != "")
    .groupBy(x => x)
    .mapValues(_.size)
    .toSeq
    .sortBy(_._2)
    .reverse
